Class Board

java.lang.Object
board.Board
public class Board extends Object
The Board class represents an 8x8 chess board and manages piece placement, movement, and game state checks such as check and checkmate.

Responsibilities:

  • Initialize the board with the standard starting chess layout.
  • Track which pieces belong to which player.
  • Provide methods to move pieces, validate moves, and check for check/checkmate conditions.
  • Render the board state in the console.

Note: The board is represented internally as a 2D array of Piece.

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board(Player whitePlayer, Player blackPlayer)
      Constructs a new board with references to both players. Used when starting an actual game to keep piece lists in sync with the board.
      Parameters:
      whitePlayer - the white player
      blackPlayer - the black player

    • Board

      public Board()
      Constructs a board without player references. Useful for temporary boards (e.g., checkmate simulations).

  • Method Details

    • getPiece

      public Piece getPiece(Position pos)
      Returns the piece at the given position, or null if the square is empty.
      Parameters:
      pos - board coordinates
      Returns:
      the piece at the position or null

    • setPiece

      public void setPiece(Piece piece, Position pos)
      Places a piece on the board at the given position.
      Parameters:
      piece - the piece to place
      pos - the target position

    • movePiece

      public void movePiece(Position from, Position to, boolean verbose)
      Moves a piece from one square to another. If verbose is true, validates the move and prints messages for invalid moves. Handles captures, updates the board state, and updates player piece lists only on real game boards (not simulation boards used for check detection).
      Parameters:
      from - source square
      to - target square
      verbose - whether to validate and throw for illegal moves

    • movePiece

      public void movePiece(Position from, Position to)
      Convenience overload: moves a piece with validation and verbose errors.

    • display

      public void display()
      Prints a text-based rendering of the board to the console.

    • validateMove

      public boolean validateMove(Position from, Position to)
      Validates whether a move from one position to another is legal. This checks both the piece’s movement rules and team color conflicts.
      Parameters:
      from - source square
      to - target square
      Returns:
      true if the move is valid, false otherwise

    • isCheck

      public boolean isCheck(Color color)
      Checks whether the king of the given color is currently in check.
      Parameters:
      color - color to check
      Returns:
      true if in check, false otherwise

    • isCheckmate

      public boolean isCheckmate(Color color)
      Checks whether the given color is in checkmate.
      Parameters:
      color - the color to check for checkmate
      Returns:
      true if checkmate, false otherwise

    • movePutsPlayerInCheck

      public boolean movePutsPlayerInCheck(Position from, Position to, Color color)
      Checks whether making a move from one position to another would leave the player of the given color in check. This is used to: - Prevent the king from moving into check - Filter out illegal moves in check situations - Validate blocking moves or captures to escape check
      Parameters:
      from - the source position of the move
      to - the target position of the move
      color - the color of the player making the move
      Returns:
      true if the move would result in the player being in check

    • isSimulation

      public boolean isSimulation()

    • copy

      public Board copy()
      Creates a shallow copy of the current board. Used for check/checkmate simulations without altering real state.
      Returns:
      new Board instance with the same piece layout
